texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: AmazonFACE Data Governance, Onboarding, and Curation Plan
texts.text: AmazonFACE Data Governance, Onboarding, and Curation Plan

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Operational documentation for standardization, QA/QC, and publication
texts.text: Operational documentation for standardization, QA/QC, and publication

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (This document is designed to be adapted to local infrastructure and policy constraints.)
texts.text: (This document is designed to be adapted to local infrastructure and policy constraints.)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This document defines the end-to-end governance workflow for bringing AmazonFACE datasets from collection to an institutional, publishable asset, aligned with ARM-style practices for standardized datastreams. It specifies (i) data product levels and quality expectations, (ii) the onboarding process from 'as-is' raw uploads to curated products, (iii) dataset entity rules (datastream boundaries), (iv) automation requirements for continuous streams, and (v) an implementation timeline for publishing the prioritized datasets.
texts.text: This document defines the end-to-end governance workflow for bringing AmazonFACE datasets from collection to an institutional, publishable asset, aligned with ARM-style practices for standardized datastreams. It specifies (i) data product levels and quality expectations, (ii) the onboarding process from 'as-is' raw uploads to curated products, (iii) dataset entity rules (datastream boundaries), (iv) automation requirements for continuous streams, and (v) an implementation timeline for publishing the prioritized datasets.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data Mentors : domain scientists responsible for scientific interpretation and context.
texts.text: Data Mentors : domain scientists responsible for scientific interpretation and context.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Project Management : coordinators responsible for prioritization, milestones, and sign-off.
texts.text: Project Management : coordinators responsible for prioritization, milestones, and sign-off.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Curation Team : data engineers and curators responsible for automation, QC, and publication.
texts.text: Curation Team : data engineers and curators responsible for automation, QC, and publication.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This document does not prescribe a specific repository technology (e.g., object storage versus POSIX) nor DOI registration mechanics. These are to be implemented according to institutional policy.
texts.text: This document does not prescribe a specific repository technology (e.g., object storage versus POSIX) nor DOI registration mechanics. These are to be implemented according to institutional policy.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A Dataset (also referred to as a datastream ) is the primary publishable unit. A dataset entity must not mix different instruments; each instrument class or data product should be represented as a separate dataset entity (e.g., met for meteorology; co2flux for carbon flux).
texts.text: A Dataset (also referred to as a datastream ) is the primary publishable unit. A dataset entity must not mix different instruments; each instrument class or data product should be represented as a separate dataset entity (e.g., met for meteorology; co2flux for carbon flux).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Legacy/Inactive : historical datasets that are static and not updated.
texts.text: Legacy/Inactive : historical datasets that are static and not updated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Active : continuously updated datasets with scheduled ingestion and versioning.
texts.text: Active : continuously updated datasets with scheduled ingestion and versioning.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3 Data product levels and quality expectations
texts.text: 3 Data product levels and quality expectations

texts.label: text
texts.orig: AmazonFACE data products are organized into levels to clearly separate preservation, calibration, QC, and value-added processing:
texts.text: AmazonFACE data products are organized into levels to clearly separate preservation, calibration, QC, and value-added processing:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Raw instrument output in its native format. Not intended for direct public use; preserved for provenance and auditing.
texts.text: Raw instrument output in its native format. Not intended for direct public use; preserved for provenance and auditing.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data converted to a standard format (typically NetCDF), with calibration coefficients applied and represented in engineering units (e.g., C, m/s).
texts.text: Data converted to a standard format (typically NetCDF), with calibration coefficients applied and represented in engineering units (e.g., C, m/s).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: a1 products with automated quality-control checks and flags (e.g., min/max range tests, missing/invalid values, and delta/spike checks). This is typically the most appropriate communityfacing level for scientific reuse.
texts.text: a1 products with automated quality-control checks and flags (e.g., min/max range tests, missing/invalid values, and delta/spike checks). This is typically the most appropriate communityfacing level for scientific reuse.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Derived products obtained from multi-instrument fusion and/or advanced algorithms that produce new geophysical variables.
texts.text: Derived products obtained from multi-instrument fusion and/or advanced algorithms that produce new geophysical variables.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The b1 level must preserve the original values while adding QC information (flags) whenever feasible. Core automated checks include:
texts.text: The b1 level must preserve the original values while adding QC information (flags) whenever feasible. Core automated checks include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Range checks : enforce plausible minimum/maximum bounds.
texts.text: Range checks : enforce plausible minimum/maximum bounds.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Delta checks : identification of abrupt changes (spikes/steps) inconsistent with expected dynamics.
texts.text: Delta checks : identification of abrupt changes (spikes/steps) inconsistent with expected dynamics.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Missing/invalid detection : explicit flagging of missing or impossible values.
texts.text: Missing/invalid detection : explicit flagging of missing or impossible values.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Data Mentor is the scientific point-of-contact for each dataset and is responsible for:
texts.text: The Data Mentor is the scientific point-of-contact for each dataset and is responsible for:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · answering scientific questions about the data (e.g., calibration status, meaning of specific fields);
texts.text: answering scientific questions about the data (e.g., calibration status, meaning of specific fields);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • validating standardized naming, gaps, and access rules during the diagnostic meeting;
texts.text: validating standardized naming, gaps, and access rules during the diagnostic meeting;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • providing acquisition context (location/plot/tower, period, sampling frequency, team);
texts.text: providing acquisition context (location/plot/tower, period, sampling frequency, team);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • approving the final published documentation and QC behavior.
texts.text: approving the final published documentation and QC behavior.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Curation Team is responsible for:
texts.text: The Curation Team is responsible for:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · maintaining the ingestion infrastructure ( /landing_zone , quarantine, archive, publication repository);
texts.text: maintaining the ingestion infrastructure ( /landing_zone , quarantine, archive, publication repository);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • converting to standard formats (a1) and implementing automated QC pipelines (b1);
texts.text: converting to standard formats (a1) and implementing automated QC pipelines (b1);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • implementing parsing, integrity checks, and renaming rules for Level 00 preservation;
texts.text: implementing parsing, integrity checks, and renaming rules for Level 00 preservation;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • generating and maintaining living documentation and changelogs;
texts.text: generating and maintaining living documentation and changelogs;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • coordinating publication packaging and operational monitoring.
texts.text: coordinating publication packaging and operational monitoring.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The onboarding workflow transforms an isolated dataset into a governed institutional asset with standards compliance from day zero.
texts.text: The onboarding workflow transforms an isolated dataset into a governed institutional asset with standards compliance from day zero.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Objective: establish ownership and context before any file movement.
texts.text: Objective: establish ownership and context before any file movement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Appoint a Data Mentor. The mentor is the focal point for scientific clarification and decisions.
texts.text: Appoint a Data Mentor. The mentor is the focal point for scientific clarification and decisions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Submit general metadata. The mentor completes an 'Intention to Submit Data' form capturing at minimum: instrument name, location (plot/tower), collection period, sampling frequency, and team involvement. These responses should populate documentation fields (e.g., authorship and acquisition details).
texts.text: Submit general metadata. The mentor completes an 'Intention to Submit Data' form capturing at minimum: instrument name, location (plot/tower), collection period, sampling frequency, and team involvement. These responses should populate documentation fields (e.g., authorship and acquisition details).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Objective: securely move raw files into the governance environment.
texts.text: Objective: securely move raw files into the governance environment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Upload to the landing zone. The mentor uploads raw native files to /landing_zone/[mentor_id]/ . Golden rule: do not rename or manually 'clean' files at this stage; preserve Level 00 as-is.
texts.text: Upload to the landing zone. The mentor uploads raw native files to /landing_zone/[mentor_id]/ . Golden rule: do not rename or manually 'clean' files at this stage; preserve Level 00 as-is.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Automated sanity check. Upon arrival, the curation team runs a Python reader to verify file integrity (not corrupted) and confirm the format matches the declared instrument model.
texts.text: Automated sanity check. Upon arrival, the curation team runs a Python reader to verify file integrity (not corrupted) and confirm the format matches the declared instrument model.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Objective: align technical curation with scientific context.
texts.text: Objective: align technical curation with scientific context.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Naming validation: the curation team proposes a standardized ARM-style dataset name; the mentor approves.
texts.text: Naming validation: the curation team proposes a standardized ARM-style dataset name; the mentor approves.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access policy: confirm embargo rules and license of use.
texts.text: Access policy: confirm embargo rules and license of use.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Gap mapping: the mentor explains missing periods, maintenance windows, and known anomalies to be recorded in the changelog.
texts.text: Gap mapping: the mentor explains missing periods, maintenance windows, and known anomalies to be recorded in the changelog.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Objective: formalize the dataset in the catalog and repositories.
texts.text: Objective: formalize the dataset in the catalog and repositories.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Standardization and movement. The curation team moves data from /landing_zone to the definitive archive (e.g., /archive/raw/ ), applying automated renaming for Level 00.
texts.text: Standardization and movement. The curation team moves data from /landing_zone to the definitive archive (e.g., /archive/raw/ ), applying automated renaming for Level 00.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Generate documentation. The curation team produces the final README (and/or catalog metadata) using approved templates, including quality warnings and reader scripts.
texts.text: Generate documentation. The curation team produces the final README (and/or catalog metadata) using approved templates, including quality warnings and reader scripts.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Each dataset entity must follow a consistent descriptive pattern:
texts.text: Each dataset entity must follow a consistent descriptive pattern:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: AmazonFACE Plot 01 - Micrometeorology - Level a1 - 1 min (2015-2023)
texts.text: AmazonFACE Plot 01 - Micrometeorology - Level a1 - 1 min (2015-2023)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A dataset entity (datastream) must not combine different instruments. Create one entity per instrument class or product family (e.g., met , co2flux ).
texts.text: A dataset entity (datastream) must not combine different instruments. Create one entity per instrument class or product family (e.g., met , co2flux ).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Legacy datasets are static; curation is a single, definitive operation.
texts.text: Legacy datasets are static; curation is a single, definitive operation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -convert original files to the standard required format (typically NetCDF), harmonizing variable names and units;
texts.text: -convert original files to the standard required format (typically NetCDF), harmonizing variable names and units;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Storage: upload the complete processed package to the dataset entity.
texts.text: Storage: upload the complete processed package to the dataset entity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Documentation: the README acts as a final report, including:
texts.text: Documentation: the README acts as a final report, including:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -a banner indicating Status: Inactive/Legacy. These data are no longer updated.
texts.text: -a banner indicating Status: Inactive/Legacy. These data are no longer updated.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Active datasets require cyclical operations with explicit versioning.
texts.text: Active datasets require cyclical operations with explicit versioning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -ingestion of raw Level 00 data (automated collection where possible);
texts.text: -ingestion of raw Level 00 data (automated collection where possible);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -routine conversion to Level b1 with automated QC flags.
texts.text: -routine conversion to Level b1 with automated QC flags.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Incremental upload: publish new files periodically (e.g., daily), without overwriting past files unless reprocessing is necessary to correct a known error.
texts.text: Incremental upload: publish new files periodically (e.g., daily), without overwriting past files unless reprocessing is necessary to correct a known error.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Living documentation: the README must be maintained as a living document with:
texts.text: Living documentation: the README must be maintained as a living document with:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -a changelog recording maintenance and configuration changes (e.g., 'Sensor replaced on 2023-10-15'),
texts.text: -a changelog recording maintenance and configuration changes (e.g., 'Sensor replaced on 2023-10-15'),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -an explicit status line (e.g., Status: Active. Update frequency: Daily ).
texts.text: -an explicit status line (e.g., Status: Active. Update frequency: Daily ).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The curation pipeline must run on a secure server with minimal human intervention (except on failure). It is triggered when new files arrive from the field (e.g., via RaiDrive, SCP, FTP, or API).
texts.text: The curation pipeline must run on a secure server with minimal human intervention (except on failure). It is triggered when new files arrive from the field (e.g., via RaiDrive, SCP, FTP, or API).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Automatic action: monitor /landing_zone for new files.
texts.text: Automatic action: monitor /landing_zone for new files.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Task: detect new arrivals and prevent concurrent writes (avoid reading incomplete files).
texts.text: Task: detect new arrivals and prevent concurrent writes (avoid reading incomplete files).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Failure behavior: move to /quarantine and notify the curation team (e-mail/alert).
texts.text: Failure behavior: move to /quarantine and notify the curation team (e-mail/alert).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Structural validation: read header/first lines to confirm the file matches the expected datalogger/instrument schema.
texts.text: Structural validation: read header/first lines to confirm the file matches the expected datalogger/instrument schema.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Processing: parse internal timestamp and site ID.
texts.text: Processing: parse internal timestamp and site ID.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Governance rationale: unique timestamps prevent accidental overwrites.
texts.text: Governance rationale: unique timestamps prevent accidental overwrites.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Extract operational metadata without altering the data:
texts.text: Extract operational metadata without altering the data:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: These metadata should update the documentation fields (coverage window, changelog entries, inventory summaries).
texts.text: These metadata should update the documentation fields (coverage window, changelog entries, inventory summaries).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Move the accepted, renamed file to the authoritative storage map ('DataMap') and ensure backup policies are applied.
texts.text: Move the accepted, renamed file to the authoritative storage map ('DataMap') and ensure backup policies are applied.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Pipeline frequency must match acquisition patterns (Table 1).
texts.text: Pipeline frequency must match acquisition patterns (Table 1).

texts.text: Table 1: Recommended pipeline execution schedule by data type.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The timeline below operationalizes governance, prioritizing quick wins (legacy/static datasets) and then enabling automation for high-frequency streams.
texts.text: The timeline below operationalizes governance, prioritizing quick wins (legacy/static datasets) and then enabling automation for high-frequency streams.

texts.text: Table 2: Planned execution windows, focus areas, and target datasets.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • Level 00 archived in authoritative storage with immutable naming.
texts.text: Level 00 archived in authoritative storage with immutable naming.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • Documentation package (README and catalog metadata) including:
texts.text: Documentation package (README and catalog metadata) including:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • Standardized dataset entity created with unambiguous scope (no mixed instruments).
texts.text: Standardized dataset entity created with unambiguous scope (no mixed instruments).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: -changelog (mandatory for active datasets; recommended for legacy datasets).
texts.text: -changelog (mandatory for active datasets; recommended for legacy datasets).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • Parsing and integrity checks pass for all ingested files.
texts.text: Parsing and integrity checks pass for all ingested files.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • Mentor sign-off confirms scientific plausibility and correctness of metadata and QC behavior.
texts.text: Mentor sign-off confirms scientific plausibility and correctness of metadata and QC behavior.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • QC flags implemented for b1 products at least for range, missing/invalid, and delta checks.
texts.text: QC flags implemented for b1 products at least for range, missing/invalid, and delta checks.

table_cells.text: Define Markdown templates and nam- ing conventions; inventory the 16 datasets and contact Data Mentors; configure /landing_zone and publica- tion repository.

Targets: Met Legacy (1), Tower De- mography (4), Photosynthesis 2016 (16), Functional Traits 2019 (13). Level 00 ingestion (secure recovery); b1 processing (unit conversion, basic QC flags, standardized NetCDF/CSV); immediate publication with documen- tation and DOI registration where ap- plicable.

grid.text: Define Markdown templates and nam- ing conventions; inventory the 16 datasets and contact Data Mentors; configure /landing_zone and publica- tion repository.

Targets: Met Legacy (1), Tower De- mography (4), Photosynthesis 2016 (16), Functional Traits 2019 (13). Level 00 ingestion (secure recovery); b1 processing (unit conversion, basic QC flags, standardized NetCDF/CSV); immediate publication with documen- tation and DOI registration where ap- plicable.

table_cells.text: Targets: Met Current (1), Sap Flow (10), Soil Respiration (5). Implement Level 00 automation (daily/hourly datalogger ingestion); implement b1 pipeline (QC, diagnos- tics, temporal aggregation e.g., 30-min means); activate streaming publication (e.g., daily updates).

Targets: Litterfall (2), Forest Inventory (3), Leaf Area Litterfall (12), LAI (6). Level 00 ingestion (field spreadsheets); b1 curation (taxonomy harmonization, typo correction, derived variables such as estimated biomass); publish com- plete historical series (2015-present).

Targets: Phenocam (11), Rhizotron (15), Belowground (14). Define storage strategy for images; de- cide product levels (b1 optional if in- dices such as greenness are computed); publish raw organized products with reinforced support documentation and usage caveats.

Targets: Photosynthesis 2025 (7), Hy- draulic (8), Liana (9). Ingest/process Level 00/b1; implement access rules and embargo metadata if required; register dataset in catalog even if files are restricted.

Single activity: validation marathon. Curation team presents all published datasets (Level 00 and b1) to their Data Mentors. Mentor checklist: metadata correctness, QC flag behav- ior, citation/authorship. Deliverable: signed Data Quality Report (final) per dataset; governance project considered complete once all datasets are vali- dated.

grid.text: Targets: Met Current (1), Sap Flow (10), Soil Respiration (5). Implement Level 00 automation (daily/hourly datalogger ingestion); implement b1 pipeline (QC, diagnos- tics, temporal aggregation e.g., 30-min means); activate streaming publication (e.g., daily updates).

Targets: Litterfall (2), Forest Inventory (3), Leaf Area Litterfall (12), LAI (6). Level 00 ingestion (field spreadsheets); b1 curation (taxonomy harmonization, typo correction, derived variables such as estimated biomass); publish com- plete historical series (2015-present).

Targets: Phenocam (11), Rhizotron (15), Belowground (14). Define storage strategy for images; de- cide product levels (b1 optional if in- dices such as greenness are computed); publish raw organized products with reinforced support documentation and usage caveats.

Targets: Photosynthesis 2025 (7), Hy- draulic (8), Liana (9). Ingest/process Level 00/b1; implement access rules and embargo metadata if required; register dataset in catalog even if files are restricted.

Single activity: validation marathon. Curation team presents all published datasets (Level 00 and b1) to their Data Mentors. Mentor checklist: metadata correctness, QC flag behav- ior, citation/authorship. Deliverable: signed Data Quality Report (final) per dataset; governance project considered complete once all datasets are vali- dated.
